text: Terence Patrick O'Neill (30 July 1938 – 16 November 2019) was a British photographer. He was known for taking pictures of the fashions, styles, and celebrities of the 1960s. His work has been seen in many exhibitions. He was awarded an honorary fellowship of the Royal Photographic Society in 2004 and the society's Centenary Medal in 2011. His work is held in the collection of the National Portrait Gallery, London. ==Works== *Terry O'Neill: Celebrity, National Portrait Gallery, London, September 2003 – March 2004 *Getty Image Gallery, the Village, Westfield London, London, July 2009. A retrospective. *San Francisco Art Exchange, San Francisco, CA, July–August in 2009. Photographs of Elton John and Frank Sinatra. *Terry O'Neill, Reworked, 2010. Six artists were given their choice of the photographer's imagery to re-work as they wished.ITV, UK; This Morning; Terry O'Neill speaks about the exhibition & contents; 18 April 2010 *Leeds Gallery, Munro House, Leeds, UK, September–October 2011. A retrospective. *Ransom Art Gallery, London, September 2016. O'Neill's David Bowie photographs coinciding with the publication of Bowie By O'Neill. Travelled to Mouche Gallery, Beverly Hills, Los Angeles, October–November 2011. *Iconic Images Gallery, London, 2018. Rare and Unseen ==References== ==Other websites== *"Photographer Terry O'Neill: a life in pictures" at The Guardian * *National Museums Liverpool, article *Millenia Fine Art, article and photographs Category:1938 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Cancer deaths in London Category:British photographers Category:Businesspeople from London
title: Terry O'Neill (photographer)
